result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald R Steele was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Bond money applied to pay in full all cost.
Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations if PO deems appropriate.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random screenings.

No contact with any known drug users/dealers.
.

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendent in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

  Pay DOC Supervision fees.

  Undergo any other assessments or evaluations deemed appropriate by PO and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronald R Steele

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Discharge regular

State by Donskey /  Def in person w/o counsel
Letter from Def rec'd / reviewed by all parties
CRT reviews - 4 yrs probation ordered
State does not oppose early release - req def remain on probation thru Oct. of this year, if no further violations, then release
CRT:  Shorten Probation period to 30 months (2 1/2 yrs) so def will be done in April.  Def still has Imposed & Stayed sitting there until that time.  Amend JOC to 30 mos Probation, beginning at original date of sentencing
Letters (2) from J.E. & C.P. filed on def's behalf

from Def    re: req early termination of probation
Per EML:  Set for Hrg - copy to DA & PO
Hearing on February 28, 2017 at 11:45 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Ronald R Steele
Current: 1319 Madison Street, La Crosse, WI 54601 United States  (Effective: 02-21-2017)
Prior: 415 Caledonia Street #3, La Crosse, WI 54601

from Def   re: to be removed from EM but will still do UA testing @ JSS
PER EML:  DENIED
from def   re: req for daily curfew in place of EM.  Per EML:  Def is serving a sentence - must follow EM rules.  I can not put on curfew only

Justice Sanctions Violations notice, filed.
EML: note & file
Check# 35484 to Cassie P
assigned PO Heidi Ulteig

Letters on behalf of def
  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed

3:30 pm Def in court w/Atty Keith A. Belzer.  Edward Minser appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All parties have reviewed the PSI.  Letters filed with the Court.  John Evans, Shane Chapman, Fidell Jefferson and Cassie Path gives statements.  Minser comments on Mr. Steele's history.  Recommends prison.  He's had 6 strikes already.  Prison is necessary here.  Asks for 5 years..  Belzer comments.  Asks for 10 mos CJ as a condition of probation...  COURT comments on Mr. Minser's statement that Mr. Steele came up with $7,500 for the cash bond, retained Atty. Belzer and is on food share.  Belzer states the bond came from his fiances' tax return.  My retainer; I let him make payments.  Didn't charge him as much as I could have.  Steele comments.  Steele comments.  Court comments. 
SENTENCE:
Total: 8 years, imposed and stayed
Initial:  4 years, imposed and stayed
Ext. Sup:  4 years, imposed and stayed
4 years probation
1 year CJ to be served on em w/12 days credit
Follow through with whatever type of treatment that's provided
AODA if PO deems it appropriate
No alcohol or controlled substances w/o Rx from a Dr.
No contact with any known drug users or dealers
Any other treatment recommended by PO
100 hours of community service (once only)
CC and DOC fees.

Appeal rights advised.
assigned PO Heidi Ulteig
Amended

4:02 pm Def in court w/Atty Keith A. Belzer.  Edward Minser appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Amended Information filed.  Minser:  There are no victim notification issues.  Statement as to Negotiated Plea filed - signed/understands
Count 1 - Delivery of Cocaine  (Fel)  961.41(1)(cm)1g  GUILTY.   
Plea Questionnaire filed - signed/understands.  Rights/Questions/Elements gone over.  No firearms and voting advised.  Possible deportation advised.
COURT finds the plea is F, V & I made.  Rights F & V waived.  Factual basis.  Accepts plea.  Found guilty and convicted.
PSI due w/in 30 day.  Get a sentencing date in 30-60 days
Belzer asks the Court to allow him to test on the 15th of August.  Have a furlough to take his son back to Chicago.  He'll come back on the 18th of August and will test then.  MInser objects.  Court will allow him to miss testing on Aug. 16th and 17th.
Plea hearing on July 28, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
Offer made, Belzer thinks issue with weights - request continuance

P, w/Atty Belzer - requests house arrest be removed
Court Remove EM and add curfew 10pm-6am.  Def can go to graduation & no testing on 6/10-11
From: Mary J Re: reschedule BBH to 6/4
off calendar
Plea hearing on June 20, 2014 at 04:00 pm.
Keith Belzer
